text: Szeto Kam-Yuen (1964 - 13 October 2012), sometimes credited as Sze To Kam Yuen or Szeto Kam Yuen, was a Hongkonger screenwriter. ==Career== Szeto began his career with TVB and later with Milkway Image.http://asiapacificarts.usc.edu/w_apa/showarticle.aspx?articleID=18396&AspxAutoDetectCookieSupport;=1 He is best known for his action-thrillers including SPL: Sha Po Lang (2005), Exiled (2006) and Flash Point (2007). Szeto died of lung cancer in Hong Kong at age 48.http://asiapacificarts.usc.edu/w_apa/showarticle.aspx?articleID=18396&AspxAutoDetectCookieSupport;=1 ===Partial screenwriter filmography=== {| class="wikitable" style="font- size:90%" |- style="text-align:center;" ! style="background:#B0C4DE;" | Year ! style="background:#B0C4DE;" | Film ! style="background:#B0C4DE;" | Source |- |1997 || Too Many Ways to Be No. 1 || |- |rowspan="3"|1998 || A Hero Never Dies || |- | Expect the Unexpected || |- | The Longest Nite || |- |2001 || Skyline Cruisers || |- |rowspan="3"|2005 ||Home Sweet Home || |- |Mob Sister || |- |SPL: Sha Po Lang || |- |rowspan="2"|2006 || Dog Bite Dog || |- | Exiled || |- |2007 || Flash Point || |- |2008 || Shamo || |- | 2009 || Accident || |- |rowspan=2|2012 || The Fairy Tale Killer || |- | Motorway || |- | 2013 || Out of Inferno || |- | 2014 || The Monkey King || |} ==References== ==External links== * Category:1964 births Category:2012 deaths Category:Hong Kong screenwriters
title: Szeto Kam-Yuen
